"http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/football/top-stories/neymar-braced-for-french-culture-shock-in-psg-debut/articleshow/60044997.cms", "body": "PARIS: After dazzling Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, the world's most expensive footballer Neymar will be welcomed to French football on Sunday at Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou in sleepy Brittany.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery said.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting 11, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential havoc he could wreak on the home defence.\n\n\"I want the fans to come on Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it,\" he said.\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree - former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014, and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat, whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game - the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground - 30 more than usual.\n\nNeymar will simply be glad to put his tax troubles behind him and get back to doing what he does best after his lawyer revealed on Saturday that the Brazilian superstar has agreed to pay a $2.5 million fine for tax evasion in his homeland.\n\nHis 2013 transfer to Barca from Sau Paulo's Santos is also the subject of a Spanish tax fraud investigation.\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the expense of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd while he's not a like-for-like replacement, Spanish press claim former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paulinho, a Brazil international, is on the verge of a 40-million-euro move to Barca from China's Guangzhou Evergrande.\n\nGet latest news & live updates on the go on your pc with News App. Download The Times of India news app for your device.", "time": "12:43:00"}

There is no reason for this hold-up to continue.\n\n\"These are complicated deals, but there is no missing document today.\n\n\"I do not need to tell you that there are a few problems within the Spanish Federation. I do not doubt that this will be quickly solved. Wolves do not eat each other, you know.\"\n\nNeymar watched from the Parc des Princes stands as PSG cruised to a low-key 2-0 win over newly-promoted Amiens in their Ligue 1 opener last time out, and coach Unai Emery will want the forward available sooner rather than later.\n\nThe 25-year-old scored 105 goals in his four seasons at Barcelona, and his new team will be expecting him to score far more over the next few years.\n\nAlthough the main goal for the capital club is to finally challenge for the Champions League crown, their first task this term will be to retake the Ligue 1 title from Monaco.\n\nSpaniard Emery has no doubt that his new arrival will help the team achieve those lofty goals, whether he makes his debut on Sunday or the following week against Toulouse.\n\n\"He's a player who will help the club get to a higher level,\" he said.\n\n\"Without Neymar PSG is a great club, but with Neymar it's a little better.\n\n\"The way we will adapt being close to a player like him... The other players here are also some great players, so together we can get better and grow.\"\n\nOnce again, PSG's main rivals for domestic honours appear to be Monaco, who are desperately trying to hang on to rising star Kylian Mbappe in the face of serious interest from Real Madrid.\n\nThe 18-year-old started in their opening 3-2 victory over Toulouse last weekend, as captain Radamel Falcao found the net.\n\nLeonardo Jardim's principality outfit will be expecting to make it two wins from two when they pay a visit to Dijon on Sunday.\n\nNice, who have the first leg of their Champions League play-off against Napoli on Wednesday, kick off the second weekend at home to promoted Troyes on Friday without their two star players the injured Mario Balotelli and new signing Wesley Sneijder.\n\nLyon's youthful side started with a 4-0 thumping of Strasbourg last week and travel out to Brittany to take on Rennes on Friday.\n\nNantes v Marseille (1500), Amiens v Angers (1800), Bordeaux v Metz (1800), Caen v Saint-Etienne (1800), Toulouse v Montpellier (1800)\n\nSunday\n\nStrasbourg v Lille (1300), Dijon v Monaco (1500), Guingamp v Paris Saint-Germain (1900)", "time": "11:56:00"}

The French side's hierarchy are looking to put in place a three-man trident of striker Edinson Cavani, new recruit Neymar and Mbappe. Sporting director Antero Henrique is also after a defensive midfielder with FC Porto's Danilo Pereira at the top of his wish list. That would cost an additional \u20ac60million - the value of his release clause.\n\nHowever, PSG will find Monaco digging in their heels over a move for Mbappe. Last season's Ligue 1 champions have so far resisted the temptation to cash in on their star man - especially to the side that challenged them for the title last season. Mbappe is believed to be concerned about the exits of team-mates Bernardo Silva, Benjamin Mendy - both sold to Manchester City - and Tiemoue Bakayoko, who is now at Chelsea.\n\nMbappe remains PSG's top target and according to Le Parisien the arrival last week of Neymar in a world-record \u20ac222million transfer has opened his eyes to the possibility of a move to the French capital.\n\nPSG aren't worried about breaking Uefa's Financial Fair Play regulations. They are confident of increasing sponsorship income on the back of the Neymar deal alone. In addition, they are hopeful of raising sale proceeds from the sales of forward Grzegorz Krychowiak, midfielder Blaise Matuidi, right-back Serge Aurier and winger Angel di Mar\u00eda.\n\nBut PSG's business this summer has irritated some of Europe's elite. The French club will have the opportunity to field any criticisms head-on when the European Clubs Association meets in Madrid on Wednesday.", "time": "10:42:00"}

"http://www.manilatimes.net/neymar-braces-psg-debut-french-culture-shock/344209/", "body": "Neymar\n\nAFP PHOTO\n\nPARIS: He has dazzled Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, but it's Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou, tucked away in sleepy Brittany, which on Sunday greets Neymar, the world's most expensive footballer.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting eleven, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouar\u00e9, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential for destruction at the feet of the Brazilian superstar.\n\n\"I want the fans to come Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it.\n\n\"But the people here are not talking about Neymar. The people here support their team.\"\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival which draws visitors from around the world.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014 and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture, the capital city club's second defeat in four visits to Guingamp since their hosts were promoted in 2013.\n\nFurthermore, former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\n\"Remember the star of the show is going to be Neymar and for us we want to welcome this very special player and his team in the best conditions possible.\"\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\n1,200km away, Barca start new era\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the cost of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"Neymar -- the football version,\" ran their headline on Saturday in a light-hearted reference to how the most expensive transfer in football history has dominated news despite Neymar not yet having kicked a ball in anger.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd the Spanish international took his chance with a goal and two assists in just 45 minutes on the field.\n\nAFP", "time": "10:12:00"}

There is no reason for this hold-up to continue.\n\n\"These are complicated deals, but there is no missing document today.\n\n\"I do not need to tell you that there are a few problems within the Spanish federation. I do not doubt that this will be quickly solved. Wolves do not eat each other, you know.\"\n\nNeymar watched from the Parc des Princes stands as PSG cruised to a low-key 2-0 win over newly-promoted Amiens in their Ligue 1 opener last time out, and coach Unai Emery will want the forward available sooner rather than later.\n\nThe 25-year-old scored 105 goals in his four seasons at Barcelona, and his new team will be expecting him to score far more over the next few years.\n\nAlthough the main goal for the capital club is to finally challenge for the Champions League crown, their first task this term will be to retake the Ligue 1 title from Monaco.\n\nSpaniard Emery has no doubt that his new arrival will help the team achieve those lofty goals, whether he makes his debut on Sunday or the following week against Toulouse.\n\n\"He's a player who will help the club get to a higher level,\" he said.\n\n\"Without Neymar PSG is a great club, but with Neymar it's a little better.\n\n\"The way we will adapt being close to a player like him... The other players here are also some great players, so together we can get better and grow.\"\n\nOnce again, PSG's main rivals for domestic honours appear to be Monaco, who are desperately trying to hang on to rising star Kylian Mbappe in the face of serious interest from Real Madrid.\n\nThe 18-year-old started in their opening 3-2 victory over Toulouse last weekend, as captain Radamel Falcao found the net.\n\nLeonardo Jardim's principality outfit will be expecting to make it two wins from two when they pay a visit to Dijon on Sunday.\n\nNice, who have the first leg of their Champions League play-off against Napoli on Wednesday, kick off the second weekend at home to promoted Troyes on Friday without their two star players the injured Mario Balotelli and new signing Wesley Sneijder.\n\nNeymar back to Brazil for World Cup qualifiers\n\nLyon's youthful side started with a 4-0 thumping of Strasbourg last week and travel out to Brittany to take on Rennes on Friday.\n\nNeymar will rejoin Brazil for 2018 World Cup qualifiers against Ecuador and Colombia in his first international duty since being transferred in a record setting deal from Barcelona to Paris Saint-Germain, national coach Tite said.\n\nRested for the June friendlies -- a 1-0 loss to Argentina and a 4-0 defeat of Australia -- the 25-year-old striker will be alongside three of his new PSG teammates: Marquinhos, Thiago Silva and Daniel Alves.\n\nTite said the drama over Neymar's transfer \"changes absolutely nothing\" for the Brazilian team.\n\nNeymar \"is looking for new challenges, but the important thing is that he be happy to play football, that he adapts well and evolves to a new level,\" Tite said.\n\nThe coach said Barcelona and PSG have \"a similar tactical formation of 4-3-3.\"\n\nThe main change to the Brazilian squad is the arrival of talented midfielder Luan Vieira, 24, who was in the Olympic gold medal winning team at Rio 2016. He currently plays for Gremio in Brazil but is bound for Spartak Moscow.\n\nAfter some torrid years, Brazil look back to their best, knocking Germany from the top of the FIFA rankings and in March becoming the first country to qualify for the 2018 World Cup. During his time in charge, Tite has eight victories out of eight in competitive matches.\n\nBrazil play Ecuador on August 31 in Porto Alegre, Brazil, and go to Barranquilla in Colombia on September 5.\n\nAFP", "time": "15:15:00"}

"http://www.theindependentbd.com/post/109193", "body": "After dazzling Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, the world's most expensive footballer Neymar will be welcomed to French football on Sunday at Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou in sleepy Brittany.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting 11, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential havoc he could wreak on the home defence.\"I want the fans to come on Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it,\" he said.\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree -- former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014, and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat, whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\nNeymar will simply be glad to put his tax troubles behind him and get back to doing what he does best after his lawyer revealed on Saturday that the Brazilian superstar has agreed to pay a $2.5 million fine for tax evasion in his homeland.\n\nHis 2013 transfer to Barca from Sau Paulo's Santos is also the subject of a Spanish tax fraud investigation.\n\n- 1,200km away, Barca start new era -Meanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the expense of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd while he's not a like-for-like replacement, Spanish press claim former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paulinho, a Brazil international, is on the verge of a 40-million-euro move to Barca from China's Guangzhou Evergrande.AFP.", "time": "12:00:00"}

"352078"}, {"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippe_Coutinho", "label": {"eng": "Philippe Coutinho"}, "score": 1, "type": "person", "id": "432717"}], "url": "http://www.sport24.co.za/Soccer/International/neymar-braced-for-psg-debut-french-culture-shock-20170813", "body": "Paris - He has dazzled Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, but it's Guingamp's humble 17 000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou, tucked away in sleepy Brittany, which on Sunday greets Neymar, the world's most expensive footballer.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) for the first time since his mind-boggling \u20ac222 million move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting eleven, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouar, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential for destruction at the feet of the Brazilian superstar.\n\n\"I want the fans to come Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it.\n\n\"But the people here are not talking about Neymar. The people here support their team.\"\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7 000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival which draws visitors from around the world.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014 and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture, the capital city club's second defeat in four visits to Guingamp since their hosts were promoted in 2013.\n\nFurthermore, former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40 000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\n\"Remember the star of the show is going to be Neymar and for us we want to welcome this very special player and his team in the best conditions possible.\"\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game - the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground - 30 more than usual.\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No 10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No 10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the cost of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"Neymar - the football version,\" ran their headline on Saturday in a light-hearted reference to how the most expensive transfer in football history has dominated news despite Neymar not yet having kicked a ball in anger.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 21:00 SA time.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd the Spanish international took his chance with a goal and two assists in just 45 minutes on the field.", "time": "07:43:00"}

Paris Saint-Germain was completed last week, but the Brazil international has yet to be granted permission to play.\n\nPSG wanted Neymar to start the season last week at the Parc des Princes against Amiens but his debut was delayed because his international transfer certificate (ITC) had not been received by the French League on time.\n\nNeymar was unveiled to the PSG fans on Saturday, but was "wiki", "id": "1042164"}], "url": "http://www.capitalfm.co.ke/sports/2017/08/13/neymar-braced-french-culture-shock-psg-debut/", "body": "Shares\n\nParis Saint-Germain's Neymar (C) pictured during a training session at the Camp des Loges in Saint-Germain-en-Laye, near Paris, on August 11, 2017 \u00a9 AFP/File / Alain JOCARD\n\nPARIS, France, Aug 13 - After dazzling Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, the world's most expensive footballer Neymar will be welcomed to French football on Sunday at Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou in sleepy Brittany.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting 11, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential havoc he could wreak on the home defence.\n\nParis Saint-Germain's new signing Neymar poses for a photo during his presentation to the fans at the Parc des Princes stadium in Paris, on August 5, 2017 \u00a9 AFP/File / JACQUES DEMARTHON\n\n\"I want the fans to come on Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it,\" he said.\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree -- former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014, and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat, whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\nNeymar will simply be glad to put his tax troubles behind him and get back to doing what he does best after his lawyer revealed on Saturday that the Brazilian superstar has agreed to pay a $2.5 million fine for tax evasion in his homeland.\n\nHis 2013 transfer to Barca from Sau Paulo's Santos is also the subject of a Spanish tax fraud investigation.\n\n- 1,200km away, Barca start new era -\n\nRed and blue lights and a welcoming message that reads in French 'Welcome, Neymar!' adorn the Eiffel Tower in Paris to celebrate the arrival of the Brazilian football star, on August 5, 2017 \u00a9 AFP/File / OLIVIER MORIN\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the expense of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd while he's not a like-for-like replacement, Spanish press claim former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paulinho, a Brazil international, is on the verge of a 40-million-euro move to Barca from China's Guangzhou Evergrande.\n\nShares", "time": "11:13:00"}

"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antoine_Kombouar\u00e9", "label": {"eng": "Antoine Kombouar\u00e9"}, "score": 3, "type": "wiki", "id": "441499"}], "url": "http://punchng.com/neymar-braced-for-psg-debut/", "body": "He has dazzled Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, but it's Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou, tucked away in sleepy Brittany, which on Sunday greets Neymar, the world's most expensive footballer.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting eleven, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouar\u00e9, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential for destruction at the feet of the Brazilian superstar.\n\n\"I want the fans to come Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it.\n\n\"But the people here are not talking about Neymar. The people here support their team.\"\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival which draws visitors from around the world.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014 and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture, the capital city club's second defeat in four visits to Guingamp since their hosts were promoted in 2013.\n\nFurthermore, former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\n\"Remember the star of the show is going to be Neymar and for us we want to welcome this very special player and his team in the best conditions possible.\"\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\n- 1,200km away, Barca start new era -\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the cost of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"Neymar -- the football version,\" ran their headline on Saturday in a light-hearted reference to how the most expensive transfer in football history has dominated news despite Neymar not yet having kicked a ball in anger.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd the Spanish international took his chance with a goal and two assists in just 45 minutes on the field.", "time": "07:45:00"}

"http://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/08/neymar-braced-french-culture-shock-psg-debut/", "body": "After dazzling Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, the world's most expensive footballer Neymar will be welcomed to French football on Sunday at Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou in sleepy Brittany.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting 11, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential havoc he could wreak on the home defence.\n\n\"I want the fans to come on Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it,\" he said.\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree -- former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014, and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat, whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\nNeymar will simply be glad to put his tax troubles behind him and get back to doing what he does best after his lawyer revealed on Saturday that the Brazilian superstar has agreed to pay a $2.5 million fine for tax evasion in his homeland.\n\nHis 2013 transfer to Barca from Sau Paulo's Santos is also the subject of a Spanish tax fraud investigation.\n\n- 1,200km away, Barca start new era -\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the expense of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd while he's not a like-for-like replacement, Spanish press claim former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paulinho, a Brazil international, is on the verge of a 40-million-euro move to Barca from China's Guangzhou Evergrande.", "time": "11:40:00"}

"http://worldsoccertalk.com/2017/08/13/neymar-braced-for-french-culture-shock-on-psg-debut/", "body": "Paris (AFP) - After dazzling Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, the world's most expensive footballer Neymar will be welcomed to French football on Sunday at Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou in sleepy Brittany.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting 11, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential havoc he could wreak on the home defence.\n\n\"I want the fans to come on Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it,\" he said.\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree -- former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014, and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat, whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\nNeymar will simply be glad to put his tax troubles behind him and get back to doing what he does best after his lawyer revealed on Saturday that the Brazilian superstar has agreed to pay a $2.5 million fine for tax evasion in his homeland.\n\nHis 2013 transfer to Barca from Sau Paulo's Santos is also the subject of a Spanish tax fraud investigation.\n\n- 1,200km away, Barca start new era -\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the expense of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd while he's not a like-for-like replacement, Spanish press claim former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paulinho, a Brazil international, is on the verge of a 40-million-euro move to Barca from China's Guangzhou Evergrande.", "time": "11:32:00"}

"body": "Kylian Mbappe set for \u00a3163m transfer after Monaco 'agree deal in principle' to sell gossip\n\nEwan Roberts for Metro.co.ukFriday 11 Aug 2017 8:08 am Share this article with Facebook Share this article with Twitter Share this article with Google Plus Share this article with Whatsapp Share this article through email Share this article through sms\n\nKylian Mbappe is on the verge of becoming the second most expensive player ever after Monaco finally relented and agreed to sell the teenager to rivals Paris Saint-Germain.\n\nWhy no-one can stop the Premier League title from heading back to Manchester this season\n\nThe 18-year-old enjoyed an incredible breakout campaign last season in which he scored 15 league goals and became the youngest ever scorer in a Champions League final.\n\nThe likes of Arsenal and Manchester City had both made contact with Mbappe and his entourage as they tried to convince him to join, though Real Madrid seemed the likeliest destination.\n\nBut, according to Marca, it is PSG who have won the race to sign the youngster, agreeing a 'deal in principle' to sign the forward for \u20ac180 million (\u00a3163m), of which \u00a318m is bonuses.\n\nThe news comes barely a week after Neymar was unveiled at the Parc des Princes in a world-record \u00a3198m move, with Mbappe excited about the prospect of playing with the Brazilian.\n\nLes Parisiens will boast perhaps the most exciting attack in Europe next season, with Unai Emery able to call on Neymar, Mbappe, Edinson Cavani and Angel Di Maria.\n\nQuite how PSG are funding the deal without breaching Financial Fair Play rules is another matter entirely, and the deal will likely see UEFA scrutinise the club's summer business to ensure FFP is not being exploited.\n\nKylian Mbappe's Ligue 1 stats 2016/17Games played29Goals15Assists8\n\nShare\n\nBoth PSG boss Unai Emery and President Nasser Al-Khelaifi made huge plays to lure Mbappe to the French capital, travelling to Bondy to talk with both the player and his father, Wilfried - the closest thing he has to an agent.\n\nAfter allaying fears that Emery's system is not suited to his style, L'Equipe - who confirm the agreement between Mbappe and PSG - say the French starlet was further won over by the capture of Neymar, who he is desperate to play alongside next season.\n\nReports in Spain say Mbappe will receive a salary of \u00a310.8m-a-year after tax (over \u00a3200,000-a-week).\n\nWhen Mbappe requested that offer be matched by Real in negotiations with the Spanish giants, they baulked at his demands and, according to COPE, said, 'Congratulations and good luck in Paris'.\n\nThe move will be a further blow to Monaco who have been asset stripped this summer, losing Benjamin Mendy, Bernardo Silva, Tiemoue Bakayoko and now, seemingly, Mbappe.\n\nPSG, meanwhile, look set to challenge for the Champions League after a summer spend that could exceed \u00a3400m, having also added Dani Alves on a free transfer, though have recouped just \u00a315m of that in player sales.\n\nMORE: Kylian Mbappe sends Manchester City fans into a frenzy by posing with Leroy Sane amid "https://guardian.ng/sport/neymar-braced-for-french-culture-shock-in-psg-debut/", "body": "Paris Saint-Germain's Brazilian forward Neymar (L) attends a training session with teammates at the Camp des Loges in Saint-Germain-en-Laye, near Paris, on August 11, 2017. ALAIN JOCARD / AFP\n\nAfter dazzling Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, the world's most expensive footballer Neymar will be welcomed to French football on Sunday at Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou in sleepy Brittany.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting 11, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential havoc he could wreak on the home defence.\n\n\"I want the fans to come on Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it,\" he said.\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree -- former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014, and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat, whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\nNeymar will simply be glad to put his tax troubles behind him and get back to doing what he does best after his lawyer revealed on Saturday that the Brazilian superstar has agreed to pay a $2.5 million fine for tax evasion in his homeland.\n\nHis 2013 transfer to Barca from Sau Paulo's Santos is also the subject of a Spanish tax fraud investigation.\n\n1,200km away, Barca start new era\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the expense of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd while he's not a like-for-like replacement, Spanish press claim former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paulinho, a Brazil international, is on the verge of a 40-million-euro move to Barca from China's Guangzhou Evergrande.", "time": "10:27:00"}

"score": 3, "type": "wiki", "id": "441499"}], "url": "http://worldsoccertalk.com/2017/08/13/neymar-braced-for-french-culture-shock-in-psg-debut/", "body": "Paris (AFP) - After dazzling Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, the world's most expensive footballer Neymar will be welcomed to French football on Sunday at Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou in sleepy Brittany.\n\nWith the transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting 11, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential havoc he could wreak on the home defence.\n\n\"I want the fans to come on Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it,\" he said.\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree -- former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014, and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat, whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\nAt the Lapin Rouge bistro, a Guingamp fan hangout 200 metres from their ground, all the talk was of Neymar and how to get a photo when the team bus arrived from the PSG hotel a 30-minute drive away at nearby Saint-Brieuc.\n\n\"I'm sure he'll score tonight,\" one of the fans told AFP.\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\nNeymar will simply be glad to put his tax troubles behind him and get back to doing what he does best after his lawyer revealed on Saturday that the Brazilian superstar has agreed to pay a $2.5 million fine for tax evasion in his homeland.\n\nHis 2013 transfer to Barca from Sao Paulo's Santos is also the subject of a Spanish tax fraud investigation.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd while he's not a like-for-like replacement, Spanish press claim former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Paulinho, a Brazil international, is on the verge of a 40-million-euro move to Barca from China's Guangzhou Evergrande.", "time": "16:40:00"}

"http://worldsoccertalk.com/2017/08/13/neymar-braced-for-psg-debut-and-french-culture-shock/", "body": "Paris (AFP) - He has dazzled Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, but it's Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou, tucked away in sleepy Brittany, which on Sunday greets Neymar, the world's most expensive footballer.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting eleven, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouar\u00e9, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential for destruction at the feet of the Brazilian superstar.\n\n\"I want the fans to come Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it.\n\n\"But the people here are not talking about Neymar. The people here support their team.\"\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival which draws visitors from around the world.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014 and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture, the capital city club's second defeat in four visits to Guingamp since their hosts were promoted in 2013.\n\nFurthermore, former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\n\"Remember the star of the show is going to be Neymar and for us we want to welcome this very special player and his team in the best conditions possible.\"\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\n- 1,200km away, Barca start new era -\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the cost of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"Neymar -- the football version,\" ran their headline on Saturday in a light-hearted reference to how the most expensive transfer in football history has dominated news despite Neymar not yet having kicked a ball in anger.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd the Spanish international took his chance with a goal and two assists in just 45 minutes on the field.", "time": "05:24:00"}

"481508"}], "url": "http://www.thetidenewsonline.com/2017/08/09/psg-plots-to-hijack-madrids-move-for-mbappe/", "body": "Paris Saint-Germain has remained in contact with Monaco forward and Real Madrid target Kylian Mbappe throughout their record-breaking pursuit of Neymar.\n\nDespite spending \u20ac222 million on a new forward, with Barcelona reluctantly talked into parting with a prized asset, PSG remains active in the summer transfer market.\n\nIt could be that they go big once again, with one of the most sought-after teenage talents in world football the next player in their sights.\n\nMbappe has registered on the Parc des Princes transfer radar for some time, with Tidesports source revealing in June that a \u20ac135m bid had been tabled.\n\nNo deal was done then, as attention turned to Neymar, but PSG has continued to remain in contact with Monaco's striking sensation.\n\nIn fact, it is understood that president Nasser Al-Khelaifi put a personal call to Mbappe during the Neymar negotiations to assure the youngster that he remained in the club's plans.\n\nPSG has also been in touch with the people around Mbappe, in particular his father Wilfried.\n\nInitial suspicions regarding the motives of the capital club have started to ease, with the project on offer in Paris becoming ever more appealing.\n\nThat has forced Monaco into a corner, with discussions regarding a planned contract extension having to be shelved due to the demands being made.\n\nMbappe has left contractual matters in the hands of his representatives and family, amid talk of interest from PSG, Real Madrid and Manchester City.\n\nTo him, of greater concern is the sporting aspect of any deal, as he seeks guarantees that he will get regular minutes in a World Cup year and a Champions League stage on which to perform.\n\nReal Madrid and PSG are considered to be the sides best equipped to offer him the game time that he craves, but Monaco have him tied to a contract which means that they do not have to sell.\n\nThe reigning champions are also reluctant to do business with a direct domestic rival, with vice-president Vadim Vasilyev eager to avoid negotiations with PSG at any cost.\n\nThat puts Real Madrid in pole position to get a deal done, but Al-Khelaifi is unlikely to throw in the towel having made a considerable effort up until this point to keep Mbappe in the loop and to have made him aware of what could happen were his future to lie in Paris.", "time": "02:38:00"}

"441499"}], "url": "http://news.abs-cbn.com/sports/08/13/17/neymar-braced-for-psg-debut-and-french-culture-shock", "body": "PARIS, France -- He has dazzled Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, but it's Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou, tucked away in sleepy Brittany, which on Sunday greets Neymar, the world's most expensive footballer.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling 222 million euro ($261 million) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting eleven, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouar\u00e9, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential for destruction at the feet of the Brazilian superstar.\n\nREAD: Dortmund, Bayern start with easy German Cup wins\n\n\"I want the fans to come Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it.\n\n\"But the people here are not talking about Neymar. The people here support their team.\"\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival which draws visitors from around the world.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014 and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture, the capital city club's second defeat in four visits to Guingamp since their hosts were promoted in 2013.\n\nFurthermore, former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\n\"Remember the star of the show is going to be Neymar and for us we want to welcome this very special player and his team in the best conditions possible.\"\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\n- 1,200km away, Barca start new era -\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the cost of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"Neymar -- the football version,\" ran their headline on Saturday in a light-hearted reference to how the most expensive transfer in football history has dominated news despite Neymar not yet having kicked a ball in anger.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd the Spanish international took his chance with a goal and two assists in just 45 minutes on the field.\n\n\u00a9 Agence France-Presse\n\nFor more sports coverage, visit the ABS-CBN Sports website.", "time": "06:53:00"}

He will be able to play on Sunday,\" said Professional Football League (LFP) on Friday.\n\nThe world's most expensive player should therefore run out into the mundane surroundings of the Stade du Roduourou -- capacity just over 15,000 -- in the tiny Brittany town of barely 7,000 people.\n\n\"Quite honestly it's better if he's there, much better,\" said Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouare, a former PSG player and Paris coach from 2009 to 2011.\n\n\"For us it is an extra source of motivation. We know that by beating PSG with Neymar it would be even more momentous. If Neymar is there it is all the better for the spectacle, for the supporters and for those who want to see him play, but we will be ready with or without him.\"\n\nNeymar was unveiled to the PSG fans at the Parc des Princes last weekend, but was forced to watch from the stands as his new team-mates cruised to a low-key 2-0 win over newly-promoted Amiens in their Ligue 1 opener.\n\nThe 25-year-old Brazilian scored 105 goals in his four seasons at Barcelona, and his new team will be expecting him to score far more over the next few years.\n\nAlthough the main goal for the capital club is to finally challenge for the Champions League crown, their first task this term will be to retake the Ligue 1 title from Monaco.\n\nCoach Unai Emery has no doubt that his new arrival will help the team achieve those lofty goals.\n\n\"He's a player who will help the club get to a higher level,\" said the Spaniard.\n\n\"Without Neymar PSG is a great club, but with Neymar it's a little better.\n\n\"The way we will adapt being close to a player like him... The other players here are also some great players, so together we can get better and grow.\"\n\nOnce again, PSG's main rivals for domestic honors appear to be Monaco, but they are in serious danger of losing rising star Kylian Mbappe to the capital outfit.\n\nThe 18-year-old, who is also wanted by Real Madrid, started in their opening 3-2 victory over Toulouse last weekend, as captain Radamel Falcao found the net.\n\nLeonardo Jardim's principality outfit will be expecting to make it two wins from two when they pay a visit to Dijon on Sunday.\n\nNice, who have the first leg of their Champions League play-off against Napoli on Wednesday, kick off the second weekend at home to promoted Troyes on Friday without their two star players, the injured Mario Balotelli and new signing Wesley Sneijder. Lyon's youthful side started with a 4-0 thumping of Strasbourg last week and travel out to Brittany to take on Rennes on Friday.\n\nMarseille visit Claudio Ranieri's Nantes on Saturday looking to build on their 3-0 win over Dijon last time out, but with captain Dimitri Payet missing due to injury.", "time": "21:50:00"}

"Camp des Loges"}, "score": 4, "type": "wiki", "id": "1042164"}], "url": "http://www.themalaymailonline.com/sports/article/neymar-braced-for-psg-debut-and-french-culture-shock", "body": "Paris Saint-Germain's Brazilian forward Neymar (centre), Brazilian defender Thiago Silva (left) and Brazilian defender Daniel Alves, attend a training session at the Camp des Loges in Saint-Germain-en-Laye, near Paris, on August 11, 2017. -- AFP picPARIS, Aug 13 -- He has dazzled Rio's imposing Maracana and Barcelona's storied Camp Nou, but it's Guingamp's humble 17,000-capacity Stade du Rouduorou, tucked away in sleepy Brittany, which today greets Neymar, the world's most expensive footballer.\n\nWith the mundanity of transfer paperwork finally resolved, the 25-year-old Brazilian magician will line up for Paris Saint-Germain for the first time since his mind-boggling \u20ac222 million (approx RM1.13 billion) move from Barcelona.\n\n\"He's physically ready to play the whole ninety minutes,\" PSG coach Unai Emery told AFP.\n\n\"He's been working well and we looked hard at tactics and free-kicks. We all want him in the starting eleven, he's a player we need in the group.\"\n\nEven Guingamp coach Antoine Kombouar\u00e9, himself a former PSG boss, wants Neymar to play despite the potential for destruction at the feet of the Brazilian superstar.\n\n\"I want the fans to come Sunday to see Guingamp win... preferably against a side with Neymar in it.\n\n\"But the people here are not talking about Neymar. The people here support their team.\"\n\nIt will be a major culture shock for Neymar in a town which has a population of just 7,000 and is best known for its annual Breton dance showcase, the Saint Loup Festival which draws visitors from around the world.\n\nHowever, that's not to say that Guingamp do not have football pedigree.\n\nThey were French Cup winners in 2009 and 2014 and last season beat PSG 2-1 in the corresponding league fixture, the capital city club's second defeat in four visits to Guingamp since their hosts were promoted in 2013.\n\nFurthermore, former Chelsea and Ivory Coast star Didier Drogba spent a season at the club in 2002/2003.\n\n\"We could have filled a stadium of 40,000 seats with no problem at all,\" said Guingamp president Bertrand Desplat whose club budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\n\"Remember the star of the show is going to be Neymar and for us we want to welcome this very special player and his team in the best conditions possible.\"\n\nJournalists from far and wide are expected for the game -- the ground's press tribune, built to hold 80 people, has been extended to cater for 350.\n\nA total of 145 stewards will be on duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\n1,200km away, Barca start new era\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the cost of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"Neymar -- the football version,\" ran their headline yesterday in a light-hearted reference to how the most expensive transfer in football history has dominated news despite Neymar not yet having kicked a ball in anger.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd the Spanish international took his chance with a goal and two assists in just 45 minutes on the field. -- AFP", "time": "04:42:00"}

budget is an eighth of what PSG paid for Neymar.\n\n\"Remember the star of the show is going to be Neymar and for us we want to welcome this very special player and his team in the best conditions duty at the ground -- 30 more than usual.\n\n1,200km away, Barca start new era\n\nMeanwhile, French media speculated over who in the expensively-assembled PSG team will make way for Neymar.\n\nLe Parisien suggested it will be Javier Pastore, the Argentine star who was the first major signing after PSG were bought by their ambitious Qatari owners.\n\n\"After first giving up his No.10 shirt, will he (Pastore) now give him (Neymar) his place in the team?\" Le Parisien asked of the player who took up the No.10 shirt after Zlatan Ibrahimovic left for Manchester United last season, only to hand it to the Brazilian this summer.\n\n\"Neymar will start on the left at the cost of Pastore.\"\n\nSports daily L'Equipe saw things differently, though.\n\n\"Neymar -- the football version,\" ran their headline on Saturday in a light-hearted reference to how the most expensive transfer in football history has dominated news despite Neymar not yet having kicked a ball in anger.\n\n\"A trio of Neymar, Pastore and Angel di Maria will support (striker) Ederson Cavani,\" predicted L'Equipe.\n\nThe match in Guingamp kicks-off at 1900GMT.\n\nAn hour later, and around 1,200km further south, Barcelona will start their first competitive match without Neymar by facing bitter rivals Real Madrid in the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup.\n\nBarca's scattergun approach to finding a replacement for Neymar has so far been unsuccessful with bids for Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho and Ousmane Dembele of Borussia Dortmund rebuffed.\n\nGerard Deulofeu was handed Neymar's role alongside Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez up front in Monday's 5-0 friendly win over Chapecoense on his return to the club after spells at Everton and AC Milan.\n\nAnd the Spanish international took his chance with a goal and two assists in just 45 minutes on the field.", "time": "04:55:00"}

"score": 3, "type": "wiki", "id": "1292416"}], "url": "http://www.theroar.com.au/2017/08/08/barca-need-sign-player-replace-neymar/", "body": "When Kylian Mbapp\u00e9 scored a hat-trick for Monaco in December last year at the tender age of 17, it was at that moment the football world opened their eyes and took notice.\n\n26 goals later, the young Frenchman is tipped to be the next Thierry Henry. With the extraordinary talent he possesses, it's easy to see why.\n\nHe has been heavily linked with a staggering $210 million move to Real Madrid which would be the second highest transfer fee in history. For a now 18-year-old who has only played six months of first tier football shows how mature he is.\n\nNow it comes down to a young and inexperienced player to practically choose his next destination, but which club would suit him best?\n\nFirst off, I'll begin by saying that now is the right time for Mbappe to move on from the Principality. Seeing as Monaco have sold their star names such as Bernardo Silva, Benjamin Mendy and Ti\u00e9mou\u00e9 Bakayoko, it should make him realise that bigger and better things await as he needs a bigger challenge.\n\nA knee injury late in the second half in the opening game of the season against Toulouse on Saturday will make him think twice about turning down a chance to sign for either Real Madrid or Barcelona as injuries happen in football. This is an opportunity that doesn't arise for many.\n\nReal Madrid have been in negotiations for Mbapp\u00e9's signature for seemingly this whole transfer window. It would be cruel on the club to have the player turn them down, but Mbapp\u00e9 would be making the right decision if he does choose to look elsewhere.\n\nWith the World Cup just around the corner, the Frenchman has been given chances under Didier Deschamps. This should be his primary focus heading into this new season because he has every possible chance of gaining a starting berth.\n\nWith Cristiano Ronaldo, Karim Benzema and Gareth Bale dominating the front three, it will be hard for Mbapp\u00e9 to get consistent playing time under Zidane. Will he settle in? Will he succumb under the pressure of the fans? Who will drop to the bench if Mbapp\u00e9 does manage to start? These are all questions that need to be answered.\n\n(photo: AFP)\n\nAt Barcelona however, Mbapp\u00e9 would find it easy to slot into the front three with Messi and Suarez after the departure of Neymar to PSG. A tactical change may be required as Mbapp\u00e9 and Suarez are both out and out strikers, which may lead to the new manager reverting to a 4-3-2-1 with Messi filling the number 10 role.\n\nFor me, he would take the club by storm and send a message to the rest of the world that they are ready to bring in the youth in exchange for the old for the likes of Andreas Iniesta and Sergio Busquets.\n\nIf he makes the move to the Catalan club, learning off Luis Suarez would be more beneficial than playing with any of the front three in the Madrid capital. This would make Mbapp\u00e9 an even more clinical finisher and improve on certain weaknesses in his game, most notably his defensive contribution and work rate, something that it is hammered into Suarez's game.\n\nIf Barcelona are able to add a few more players to their squad for the purpose of depth, then they can really challenge once again for the Champions league which will give Mbapp\u00e9 a great chance of cementing his spot at next year's World Cup.\n\nThis kid is destined for greatness, and it will be interesting to see if he can match the heights of the Brazilian Ronaldo in the near future. In a few years time when Messi and Ronaldo hang up the boots, Neymar could be facing some competition for the Ballon'dor award. In order to do that, he needs to choose Barcelona as his next home.\n\nIt's your move, Kylian.", "time": "22:18:00"}

Sunday after the French football federation confirmed it had received the player's transfer certificate.\n\nThe Brazilian, whose 222 million euros ($262 mln) signing from Barcelona doubled the world-record transfer fee, was prevented from playing in PSG's first Ligue 1 match of the season against Amiens last week because his registration had gone through too late.\n\n\"One thing is clear: we want him to make his debut (on Sunday),\" PSG coach Unai Emery told reporters. \"He's been good in training. He is ready. We want him to be in the squad and to start. He's a player we need.\"\n\n\"I think he is ready to start the game.\"\n\nThe French football federation (FFF) confirmed that Neymar was now licensed to play in France.\n\n\"The FFF confirms it has received the transfer certificate of Neymar Jr, sent by the RFEF (Spanish football federation),\" the FFF said on its Twitter feed on Friday.\n\nPSG opened the season by beating Amiens 2-0 at the Parc des Princes last Saturday.
